regarding water resources at the household level', 'The purpose of this research is to investigate how local dynamics are impacted by interventions from other actors, as well as how these different forces interact with one another', 'He argues that this viewpoint provides a better understanding than one based solely on economic interests or legal rights (Finger, 1986)', 'Finger’s “network” approach is particularly relevant for examining environmental governance, as it emphasizes the importance of local dynamics and power relations in shaping collective action.', "This can be seen through Ostrom's (1990) work on common-pool resources, which highlights the role of external influences in shaping local resource management practices", 'Both periods involved interventions that aimed at improving water resource management in Le Bignon, but they had different impacts on collective action within the community.', 'This policy included provisions related to water management, such as subsidies for irrigation systems and regulations on water usage', 'The local authorities implemented several initiatives aimed at improving water management in Le Bignon, including the promotion of more efficient irrigation techniques and the establishment of community-based committees to oversee water distribution', "The research questions guiding this article explore how different actors (local farmers, village representatives, government agencies) influence one another's capacity to act regarding water resources at the household level", 'In both periods analyzed (1975-1980 and 2 cv) the involvement of national policies, local authorities, and other actors created tensions among members of Le Bignon due to disparities in access to resources or the implementation of new practices without sufficient consideration for existing social dynamics', 'In the first period, when national policies were introduced without sufficient consultation with local stakeholders, conflicts emerged as some community members felt excluded or disadvantaged by these changes', 'Finger’s conceptual framework highlights how different forms of intervention (economic interest model, rights model, and social network model) can influence local dynamics and access to resources', 'By working collaboratively with local stakeholders and empowering community-based governance structures, external actors
